review_title: A great place to work that really value you as an employee
pros: Employee benefits, good values, feel cared for, employee rewards systems, training, events for staff, family feel
cons: Very busy days but I like that

job_title: Domestic Abuse Support Worker in Burnley, England
pros: Rewarding work and good work colleagues.
cons: Underpaid Usually end up leaving late Understaffed Unorganised

pros: - Working with individuals who struggle with drug and alcohol problems. - Support prisoners on a 1:1 basis. - Run groups on drug and alcohol awareness. - Discuss individual action plans for each prisoner.
cons: - Not good pay - Lack of managerial support

review_title: Tries hard but often misses the mark
pros: Flexible working, good IT dept, some good employees/managers
cons: Low pay, top heavy, some inexperienced managers who don't understand the roles

job_title: Service Development Manager in Manchester, England
pros:
Values led organisation
Sense of belonging to the group
Listen to staff
Hive feedback-confidential survey for staff feedback
cons: Other managers from other groups do not align with the values of Calico

job_title: IT Systems Manager in Burnley, England
pros: Company with strong customer focused values. Fantastic opportunities to grow and learn your particular profession.
cons: Low Salaries in comparison with similar organisations

pros:
I have worked at Calico for almost a year now and I can honestly say this is a company that truly lives its values.   Values are at the heart of everything - its recruitment process, the leadership training, management style and decision making.
The Groups vision and aspirations reflect its values and are purposeful and inspirational.
Every member of staff understands what the business is there to achieve and many go above and beyond to make a difference to their customers.
cons: Can somewhere be too nice to work?  Do people get too cosy in what they are doing?  Do Calico staff challenge each other enough?

pros:
Excellent working conditions with light, airy offices - very modern. 
Good managers with regular meetings to discuss any issues or concerns. 
Good holidays and flexi-time available for certain positions. 
Well-being of employees a priority with plenty of opportunities to attend events.
cons: Due to recent government and funding cut-backs, certain departments have had to make redundancies.  This has caused a drop in morale for staff with people concerned for the future of their positions.

review_title: You're likely to make lifelong friends
job_title: Independent Living Coordinator in Burnley, England
pros: Calico is a vibrant, challenging and friendly place to work with a  real focus on staff development  . Always looking forward seeking  opportunities to make a positive difference to peoples also make's it an exciting place to work s I get a real feeling that the work I do really matters. Great staff perks
cons: Outside  influences really , funding cuts can make things challenging !!

pros:
People are welcoming and helpful with no office politics.   Staff are cared for and the work interesting, challenging and you feel that you can make a difference.

Managers are approachable,  staff are kept informed and are listened to.

While it is businesslike,  customers are put first and it's not just about the money
cons: Very busy, work is challenging and they have high expectations

pros:
It is a genuinely caring organisation which looks after its staff and makes decisions based on the company values.

The company also recognises health and well-being and ensures it looks after its staff
cons: We are not always the slickest in how we do things but this is a big focus at the moment and we are implementing new systems

pros: Full support to develop as a staff member, sound ethics and strong leadership make for a fun and creative place to work
cons: Constant challenges and change and fast paced but not really a negative if you like that work environment

job_title: Building Foundation Administrator in Burnley, England
pros: Fantastic professional development for employees, friendly environment to work in with excellent staff and great support from employers including managers and supervisors
cons: My stay with them wasn't long enough as I was on a temporary contract and wanted to go permanent. But unfortunately at the time they didn't have any vacancies that I could apply for.

review_title: Really Good Company to Work for!
job_title: Human Resources Assistant in Burnley, England
pros: I love working for the Calico Group as my job role is so varied. Calico have also funded my CIPD Level 5 Higher Level Apprenticeship in HR which has allowed me to develop myself professionally.  :)
cons: HR is a busy team to work in, but the team are lovely so that helps!

pros: Great training package and fantastic support for customers
cons: Changed my wage structure to avoid paying me more, cover staff get paid for sleep overs whilst permanent staff don't.

job_title: Tenancy Support Officer in Blackpool, England
pros: good company to work for. However, we had an exceptional team,
cons: only a short term contract and beholden to these contracts.  only cover certain areas.

pros: Wellbeing of staff is important, they make a difference to the lives of their customers
cons: knowing who does what is difficult at times

job_title: Customer Service Advisor in Burnley, England
pros: Great pay, weekday work - no weekends, company holidays, great annual leave, helpful management
cons: Different shift times (not consistent), temporary contracts

pros: Lovely friendly people very supportive
cons: Could do on boarding more efficiently

pros: Invest in people - values led
